Material used.Description: PC12/TetOn cells were used to assess alpha-synuclein expression levels.

Readout description.Result Description: Alpha-synuclein expression levels (both WT and A30P) were quantified with increasing doxycycline concentrations, showing a positive correlation with protein expression.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent Western blot experiments were performed.

Basic negative control.Description: PC12/TetOn cells transfected with an empty pBI-G vector were used as a control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Densitometric analysis was used for quantification.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression levels comparable to baseline or control as determined by densitometric analysis.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from baseline or control expression levels as determined by densitometric analysis.

Material used.Description: PC12/TetOn cells were used to assess cell viability under different conditions.

Readout description.Result Description: At low expression levels, A30P showed a protective effect against oxidative stress similar to WT. At high expression levels, A30P lost this protective effect, but no toxicity was observed.

Basic negative control.Description: Uninduced cells or mock-transfected cells were used as controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post-hoc test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability comparable to control conditions (no significant reduction).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in cell viability compared to control (P<0.05).

Material used.Description: PC12/TetOn cells were used to assess alpha-synuclein expression and localization.

Readout description.Result Description: Immunocytochemistry confirmed cytoplasmic increase of alpha-synuclein (both WT and A30P) after doxycycline induction.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Presence of immunoreactivity similar to baseline or control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in immunoreactivity compared to control.

Material used.Description: PC12/TetOn cells were used to detect amyloid aggregates.

Readout description.Result Description: No evidence of insoluble alpha-synuclein fibrils was found for A30P even at high expression levels.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No detectable fluorescence indicating absence of amyloid aggregates.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Detectable fluorescence indicating presence of amyloid aggregates.

Material used.Description: PC12/TetOn cells were used to detect oligomeric species of alpha-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: No A11 reactivity was observed for A30P even after macroautophagy inhibition.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent replicates were performed for densitometric quantification.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Densitometric quantification normalized to alpha-tubulin immunoreactivity.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No detectable A11 reactivity indicating absence of oligomers.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Detectable A11 reactivity indicating presence of oligomers.
